Content: :ibox:THIS QUESTION HAS TWO PARTS.
What is the meaning of RECURRENCE as it is used in paragraph 16 of The Count of Monte Cristo?

A.Choice: a desire for something hard to obtain

B.Choice: an instance of something happening again

C.Choice: a way of thinking about something important

D.Choice: an understanding of something previously unknown

Content: Which evidence from The Count of Monte Cristo supports the correct answer in Part A?

A.Choice: “'... to but knock against the wall, and he will cease to work ...'” (paragraph 12)

B.Choice: “'... he will soon resume it.'” (paragraph 12)

C.Choice: “Full of hope, Edmond swallowed a few mouthfuls of bread and water ... ” (paragraph 15)

D.Choice: “Edmond did not close his eyes.” (paragraph 17)

Content: :ibox:THIS QUESTION HAS TWO PARTS.
In The Count of Monte Cristo, how does the noise in the wall affect Edmond Dantes?

A.Choice: It causes him to summon the jailer.

B.Choice: It gives him a sense of hope.

C.Choice: It frightens him into behaving foolishly.

D.Choice: It proves that he will escape.

Content: Which evidence from The Count of Monte Cristo supports the answer to Part A?

A.Choice: “So many loathsome animals inhabited the prison, that their noise did not, in general, awake him ... ” (paragraph 2)

B.Choice: “It seemed to him that heaven had at length taken pity on him ... ” (paragraph 3)

C.Choice: “No, no, doubtless he was deceived, and it was but one of those dreams that forerun death!” (paragraph 4)

D.Choice: “Suddenly the jailer entered.” (paragraph 6)

Content: :ibox:THIS QUESTION HAS TWO PARTS.
What is a central idea of The Count of Monte Cristo?

A.Choice: Poor conditions cause a man to imagine sounds in his cell.

B.Choice: A jailer takes pity on a hungry man and offers him food.

C.Choice: The lack of company causes a man to befriend his jailer.

D.Choice: A confined man is energized by the possibility of escape.

Content: Which evidence from The Count of Monte Cristo BEST supports the answer to Part A?

A.Choice: “Dantes raised himself up and began to talk about everything; about the bad quality of the food, about the coldness of his dungeon, grumbling and complaining, in order to have an excuse for speaking louder, and wearying the patience of his jailer, who out of kindness of heart had brought broth and white bread for his prisoner.” (paragraph 8)

B.Choice: “Fortunately, he fancied that Dantes was delirious; and placing the food on the rickety table, he withdrew.” (paragraph 9)

C.Choice: “'There can be no doubt about it,' thought he; 'it is some prisoner who is striving to obtain his freedom. Oh, if I were only there to help him!'” (paragraph 10)

D.Choice: “Unfortunately, Edmond's brain was still so feeble that he could not bend his thoughts to anything in particular.” (paragraph 11)

Content: :ibox:THIS QUESTION HAS TWO PARTS.
What is the meaning of SCALE as it is used in speech 7 of the scene from Blessings?

A.Choice: to remove in layers

B.Choice: to increase or reduce in size

C.Choice: to climb up or over something

D.Choice: to create according to certain proportions

Content: Which phrase from the scene from Blessings BEST helps the reader to understand the meaning of SCALE?

A.Choice: “And thinner. The air feels thinner.” (speech 2)

B.Choice: “High as you can get without ropes.” (speech 7)

C.Choice: “See that ridge? Sheer rock-face.” (speech 7)

D.Choice: “But I make 'em. And sell 'em.” (speech 28)

Content: :ibox:THIS QUESTION HAS TWO PARTS.
How does the author of Blessings use stage directions to reveal that the two characters are learning more about each other?

A.Choice: by describing their reactions

B.Choice: by describing their activities

C.Choice: by describing their relationship

D.Choice: by describing their accomplishments

Content: Which evidence from the scene from Blessings supports the correct answer in Part A?

A.Choice: “(RENE reaches the top. She looks out for the first time.)” (before speech 4)

B.Choice: “(Proud of remembering.)” (speech 12)

C.Choice: “(JESSE looks right at RENE, surprised by her directness.)” (before speech 36)

D.Choice: “(RENE waits for an answer.)” (before speech 38)

Content: :ibox:THIS QUESTION HAS TWO PARTS.
What is one way the stage directions help contribute meaning to the scene?

A.Choice: by establishing a lighthearted mood

B.Choice: by foreshadowing the play's conflict

C.Choice: by summarizing the plot of the play

D.Choice: by comparing the characters' points of view

Content: Which TWO pieces of evidence support the answer to Part A?

A.Choice: “(RENE reaches the top. She looks out for the first time.)” (before speech 4)

B.Choice: “(Proud of remembering.)” (speech 12)

C.Choice: “(RENE crosses to have a seat near the edge.)” (speech 20)

D.Choice: “(JESSE looks right at RENE, surprised by her directness.)” (before speech 36)

E.Choice: “(Enjoying repeating what he said to her.)” (speech 45)

Content: You have read a passage from The Count of Monte Cristo and a scene from Blessings. Think about the similarities and differences in how the two authors develop the themes in each text.
Write an essay in which you identify a theme from each text and analyze how each theme is developed. Be sure to include specific details from BOTH selections.
:ibox:THIS QUESTION HAS TWO PARTS.
How do the dragons' actions contribute to the development of the theme of the folktale?

A.Choice: Their playfulness shows that appearances can be misleading when making character judgments.

B.Choice: Their willingness to disobey the Jade Emperor shows that sacrifice is often needed for the good of others.

C.Choice: Their reliability shows that respecting one's elders and following instructions are necessary for a successful society.

D.Choice: Their respect for the Jade Emperor shows that children can learn much from their ancestors about historical events.

Content: Which TWO paragraphs from the folktale support the answer to Part A?

A.Choice: paragraph 1

B.Choice: paragraph 8

C.Choice: paragraph 13

D.Choice: paragraph 18

Content: :ibox:THIS QUESTION HAS TWO PARTS.
As used in paragraph 19, what is the meaning of the word RESOLUTELY?

A.Choice: acting with determination

B.Choice: hesitating to act

C.Choice: producing results

D.Choice: proceeding cautiously

Content: Which quotation MOST helps the reader understand the meaning of RESOLUTELY?

A.Choice: “'Look, is there not plenty of water in the sea where we live?'” (paragraph 16)

B.Choice: “'We should scoop it up and spray it towards the sky.'” (paragraph 16)

C.Choice: “'Good idea!' said the others as they clapped their hands.” (paragraph 17)

D.Choice: “'Then let's begin. We will never regret it,' said Long Dragon.” (paragraph 20)

Content: :ibox:THIS QUESTION HAS TWO PARTS.
In the folktale, how do the dragons MOST impact the resolution of the plot?

A.Choice: by providing rain for the people

B.Choice: by becoming imprisoned in mountains

C.Choice: by creating a permanent water supply

D.Choice: by angering the god of the sea

Content: Which detail from the folktale BEST supports the answer to Part A?

A.Choice: “'The water will be like rain drops and come down to save the people...'” (paragraph 16)

B.Choice: “... discovered these events and reported to the Jade Emperor.” (paragraph 23)

C.Choice: “'Go and get four mountains to lay upon them...'” (paragraph 26)

D.Choice: “... they turned themselves into four rivers...” (paragraph 27)

Content: :ibox:THIS QUESTION HAS TWO PARTS.
Which difference in attitudes between the Jade Emperor and the dragons influences events later in the folktale?

A.Choice: The Jade Emperor is amused by the needs of the people, and the dragons are annoyed.

B.Choice: The Jade Emperor is angered by the needs of the people, and the dragons are pleased.

C.Choice: The Jade Emperor is indifferent about the needs of the people, and the dragons are concerned.

D.Choice: The Jade Emperor is upset about the needs of the people, and the dragons are worried.

Content: Which paragraphs provide evidence to support the answer to Part A?

A.Choice: paragraphs 2−3

B.Choice: paragraphs 5−6

C.Choice: paragraphs 11−12

D.Choice: paragraphs 22−23

Content: :ibox:THIS QUESTION HAS TWO PARTS.
Why does the author MOST LIKELY place the information in paragraphs 1–2 at the beginning of “Energy Story”?

A.Choice: to encourage the reader to learn how electronic devices are made

B.Choice: to show the reader how different machines can improve our lives

C.Choice: to draw the reader in by showing how electricity affects everyone

D.Choice: to teach the reader how to use electricity in different settings

Content: Which detail from “Energy Story” BEST supports the answer in Part A?

A.Choice: “... walk through your school, house or apartment ...” (paragraph 2)

B.Choice: “... how many things we use each and every day that depend on electricity.” (paragraph 2)

C.Choice: “... in the same way the moon spins around the earth.” (paragraph 5)

D.Choice: “... each person would have a bucket of water to pour from one bucket to another.” (paragraph 12)

Content: :ibox:THIS QUESTION HAS TWO PARTS.
Which sentence BEST states the central idea of paragraphs 21–22 in “Energy Story”?

A.Choice: Materials that are insulators and conductors have a high resistance to electricity.

B.Choice: It is more difficult for electricity to pass through insulators than conductors.

C.Choice: Insulators and conductors are able to generate a high amount of electricity.

D.Choice: Electrons move through rubber easier than they move through metal.

Content: Which sentence from “Energy Story” BEST supports the answer in Part A?

A.Choice: “Electricity is conducted through somethings better than others.”

B.Choice: “Its resistance measures how well something conducts electricity.”

C.Choice: “Some things hold their electrons very tightly.”

D.Choice: “Other materials have some loosely held electrons, which move through them very easily.”

Content: :ibox:THIS QUESTION HAS TWO PARTS.
Which phrase is closest in meaning to the word DELIBERATELY as it is used in paragraph 3 of “Short Circuit”?

A.Choice: for the most part

B.Choice: by general agreement

C.Choice: with short notice

D.Choice: with careful consideration

Content: Which detail from “Short Circuit” provides the BEST clue to the meaning of the word DELIBERATELY?

A.Choice: “good conductor”

B.Choice: “not as good”

C.Choice: “chosen to”

D.Choice: “very low”

Content: :ibox:THIS QUESTION HAS TWO PARTS.
Which sentence BEST states a central idea of “Short Circuit”?

A.Choice: Appliances can be destroyed by a heavy flow of electrons.

B.Choice: The flow of electrons follows a path of least resistance.

C.Choice: Fuses are an important means to keep homes safe from electrical hazards.

D.Choice: Circuit breakers are a tool to control the flow of electricity in homes.

Content: Which detail from the article provides the BEST example of the central idea in Part A?

A.Choice: “In a normal electric circuit, an electric current powers an appliance, such as a refrigerator or TV.”

B.Choice: “Every such appliance has a certain amount of resistance to the current flow, which keeps the current from reaching very large values.”

C.Choice: “Although houses today often contain circuit breakers rather than fuses, fuses are still around.”

D.Choice: “... the wire in the fuse heats up quickly and melts, breaking the circuit and preventing a fire from breaking out.”

Content: :ibox:THIS QUESTION HAS TWO PARTS.
Which step of the experiment is repeated multiple times in “Short Circuit”?

A.Choice: Use an alligator clip to attach a copper wire to a battery terminal.

B.Choice: Attach one end of an iron wire to the other battery terminal.

C.Choice: Use a second alligator clip to attach the other end of the copper wire to the iron wire.

D.Choice: Shorten the distance between the second alligator clip and the battery.

Content: A result occurs when the step is repeated in the experiment. Which phrase from “Short Circuit” shows the result of the repeated step that is the answer to Part A?

A.Choice: “... deliberately chosen to have very low resistance.”

B.Choice: “... voltage of the battery pushes electrons through the circuit ...”

C.Choice: “... more current flows ...”

D.Choice: “... which keeps the current from reaching very large values.”

Content: :ibox:THIS QUESTION HAS TWO PARTS.
Which paragraph BEST summarizes the conclusions of the experiment in “Short Circuit”?

A.Choice: paragraph 2

B.Choice: paragraph 3

C.Choice: paragraph 4

D.Choice: paragraph 5

Content: Identify THREE details from “Short Circuit” that provide the BEST summary of the conclusions in the experiment.

A.Choice: Most houses have circuit breakers.

B.Choice: Frayed wires can touch appliances.

C.Choice: Iron wire is a good conductor of electricity.

D.Choice: The length of a wire affects its resistance.

F.Choice: A short circuit occurs when there is a high flow of current with low resistance.

G.Choice: Appliances can short-circuit, creating a fire hazard.

Content: :ibox:THIS QUESTION HAS TWO PARTS.
As it is used in the article, what does the word SOLUTION mean?

A.Choice: an ability to combine smaller parts

B.Choice: an answer to a problem

C.Choice: a capacity to carry a stronger charge

D.Choice: a liquid mixture

Content: Which detail from “Conducting Solutions” provides the BEST clue to the meaning of the word SOLUTION?

A.Choice: “conducts electricity” (paragraph 1)

B.Choice: “dissolved in water” (paragraph 2)

C.Choice: “are no ions” (paragraph 3)

D.Choice: “made of molecules” (paragraph 4)

Content: :ibox:THIS QUESTION HAS TWO PARTS.
In “Conducting Solutions,” why does the author MOST LIKELY include the information in paragraph 5?

A.Choice: to explain how solutions that contain ions conduct electricity

B.Choice: to show how some solutions low in ions can conduct electricity

C.Choice: to describe several ways to use solutions that conduct electricity

D.Choice: to list several solutions that are effective conductors of electricity

Content: Which detail from paragraph 5 of “Conducting Solutions” BEST supports the answer in Part A?

A.Choice: “This is what happens when ammonia and vinegar are mixed.”

B.Choice: “An ammonia solution contains only a few ions, and it conducts electricity only poorly.”

C.Choice: “A vinegar solution also contains only a few ions and conducts only a little electricity.”

D.Choice: “But when these solutions are mixed, the ammonia reacts with the acid in vinegar (acetic acid), and they form a lot of ions.”

Content: You have learned about electricity by reading three articles, “Energy Story,” “Short Circuit,” and “Conducting Solutions.”
In an essay, analyze how each source uses explanations, examples, and/or descriptions to help accomplish its purpose. Support your response with evidence from each source.
